# Function to convert duration string to timedelta
def convert_to_timedelta(duration: str) -> timedelta:
    units = {'s': 'seconds', 'm': 'minutes', 'h': 'hours', 'd': 'days'}
    return timedelta(**{units[duration[-1]]: int(duration[:-1])})

# Dictionary to store GiveawayView objects
giveaway_views = {}

class GiveawayView(discord.ui.View):
    def __init__(self, winners, item, end_time, host, bot, message):
        super().__init__(timeout=None)
        self.winners = winners
        self.item = item
        self.end_time = end_time
        self.host = host
        self.bot = bot
        self.message = message
        self.entrants = []

    @discord.ui.button(label="🎉 0", style=discord.ButtonStyle.primary, custom_id="enter_giveaway")
    async def enter_giveaway(self, interaction: discord.Interaction, button: discord.ui.Button):
        if interaction.user not in self.entrants:
            self.entrants.append(interaction.user)
            button.label = f"🎉 {len(self.entrants)}"
            await interaction.response.edit_message(view=self)
        else:
            await interaction.response.send_message("You have already entered the giveaway!", ephemeral=True)

    @discord.ui.button(emoji="👥", style=discord.ButtonStyle.secondary, custom_id="view_entrants")
    async def view_entrants(self, interaction: discord.Interaction, button: discord.ui.Button):
        entrants_list = "\n".join([f"{i+1}. {user.mention}" for i, user in enumerate(self.entrants)])
        embed = discord.Embed(title="Giveaway Entrants", description=entrants_list)
        await interaction.response.send_message(embed=embed, ephemeral=True)





@bot.hybrid_command(name="giveaway", description="Start a giveaway")
async def giveaway(ctx, winners: int, item: str, duration: str):
    end_time = datetime.now() + convert_to_timedelta(duration)
    timestamp = end_time.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
    discord_timestamp = f"<t:{int(end_time.timestamp())}:R>"

    embed = discord.Embed(title="🎉GIVEAWAY🎉", description=item)
    embed.add_field(name="Winners", value=winners)
    embed.add_field(name="Drawing", value=f"in {discord_timestamp}")
    embed.add_field(name="Hosted by", value=ctx.author.mention)
    embed.set_footer(text=f"{bot.user.name} | Ends at {timestamp}")

    view = GiveawayView(winners, item, end_time, ctx.author, bot, None)
    message = await ctx.send(embed=embed, view=view)
    view.message = message
    giveaway_views[message.id] = view

    await asyncio.sleep((end_time - datetime.now()).total_seconds())

    if len(view.entrants) < winners:
        await message.edit(content="Not enough entrants to determine winners!", embed=None, view=None)
    else:
        selected_winners = random.sample(view.entrants, winners)
        winners_list = "\n".join([user.mention for user in selected_winners])
        await message.channel.send(f"Congratulations to the winners:\n{winners_list}")
        view.stop()

@bot.hybrid_command(name="reroll", description="Reroll the giveaway")
async def reroll(ctx, *, description: str):
    async for message in ctx.channel.history(limit=100):
        if message.embeds and message.embeds[0].description == description:
            giveaway_message = message
            break
    else:
        await ctx.send("Giveaway not found. Please make sure the description is correct and the giveaway is in this channel.")
        return

    view = giveaway_views.get(giveaway_message.id)

    if view is None:
        await ctx.send("This giveaway has already ended.")
        return

    if not isinstance(view, GiveawayView):
        await ctx.send("This is not a valid giveaway message!")
        return

    if len(view.entrants) < view.winners:
        await ctx.send("Not enough entrants to determine new winners!")
    else:
        selected_winners = random.sample(view.entrants, view.winners)
        winners_list = "\n".join([user.mention for user in selected_winners])
        await giveaway_message.channel.send(f"Congratulations to the new winners:\n{winners_list}")
        await ctx.send(f"The giveaway '{description}' has been rerolled! New winners:\n{winners_list}")

import discord
from discord.ext import commands, tasks
from discord import app_commands
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
import asyncio
import heapq

class ReminderCog(commands.Cog):
    def __init__(self, bot: commands.Bot):
        self.bot = bot
        self.reminders = []  # 優先度キューとして使用
        self.reminder_task.start()

    @app_commands.command(name="setreminder", description="指定した時間に指定したチャンネルに通知を送ります。")
    @app_commands.describe(
        year="年 (省略可)",
        month="月 (省略可)",
        day="日 (省略可)",
        hour="時 (24時間表記)",
        minute="分",
        second="秒 (省略可)",
        message="通知メッセージ (省略可)",
        channel="通知を送るチャンネル (必須)"
    )
    async def set_reminder(
        self,
        interaction: discord.Interaction,
        year: int = None,
        month: int = None,
        day: int = None,
        hour: int = None,
        minute: int = None,
        second: int = None,
        message: str = "時間です！",
        channel: discord.TextChannel = None
    ):
        """指定した時間に指定したチャンネルに通知を送るスラッシュコマンド"""
        now = datetime.now()
        try:
            reminder_time = self.parse_datetime(year, month, day, hour, minute, second, now)
        except ValueError:
            await interaction.response.send_message("無効な日付または時間形式です。", ephemeral=True)
            return

        # 過去の時間が指定された場合、翌日の同じ時刻に設定
        if reminder_time <= now:
            reminder_time += timedelta(days=1)

        heapq.heappush(self.reminders, (reminder_time.timestamp(), {
            "time": reminder_time,
            "message": message,
            "channel_id": channel.id if channel else None,
            "user_id": interaction.user.id
        }))

        await interaction.response.send_message(f"リマインダーを {reminder_time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')} に設定しました！", ephemeral=True)

    @tasks.loop(seconds=1)
    async def reminder_task(self):
        now = datetime.now()
        while self.reminders and self.reminders[0][0] <= now.timestamp():
            _, data = heapq.heappop(self.reminders)
            channel_id = data["channel_id"]
            channel = self.bot.get_channel(channel_id)
            if channel:
                await channel.send(f"<@{data['user_id']}> {data['message']}")

    def parse_datetime(self, year, month, day, hour, minute, second, now):
        """ユーザーが指定した日時を datetime に変換"""
        if year is None:
            year = now.year
        if month is None:
            month = now.month
        if day is None:
            day = now.day
        if hour is None:
            hour = now.hour
        if minute is None:
            minute = now.minute
        if second is None:
            second = now.second

        try:
            return datetime(year, month, day, hour, minute, second)
        except ValueError:
            raise ValueError("無効な日付または時間です")

    @reminder_task.before_loop
    async def before_reminder_task(self):
        await self.bot.wait_until_ready()

async def setup(bot: commands.Bot):
    await bot.add_cog(ReminderCog(bot))

from discord.ext import commands, tasks
from discord import app_commands
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
import heapq

class ReminderCog(commands.Cog):
    def __init__(self, bot: commands.Bot):
        self.bot = bot
        self.reminders = []  # 優先度キューとして使用
        self.reminder_task.start()

    @app_commands.command(name="setreminder", description="指定した秒・分・時間・日後に指定したチャンネルに通知を送ります。")
    @app_commands.describe(
        seconds="何秒後にリマインダーを設定しますか？",
        minutes="何分後にリマインダーを設定しますか？",
        hours="何時間後にリマインダーを設定しますか？",
        days="何日後にリマインダーを設定しますか？",
        message="通知メッセージ (省略可)",
        channel="通知を送るチャンネル (省略可)"
    )
    async def set_reminder(
        self,
        interaction: discord.Interaction,
        seconds: int = 0,
        minutes: int = 0,
        hours: int = 0,
        days: int = 0,
        message: str = "時間です！",
        channel: discord.TextChannel = None
    ):
        """指定した秒・分・時間・日後に指定したチャンネルに通知を送るスラッシュコマンド"""
        now = datetime.now()
        reminder_time = now + timedelta(days=days, hours=hours, minutes=minutes, seconds=seconds)

        # チャンネルが指定されていない場合、コマンドが実行されたチャンネルを使用
        if channel is None:
            channel = interaction.channel

        heapq.heappush(self.reminders, (reminder_time.timestamp(), {
            "time": reminder_time,
            "message": message,
            "channel_id": channel.id,
            "user_id": interaction.user.id
        }))

        await interaction.response.send_message(f"リマインダーを {reminder_time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')} に設定しました！", ephemeral=True)

    @tasks.loop(seconds=1)  # 10秒ごとにリマインダーをチェックするように設定
    async def reminder_task(self):
        now = datetime.now()
        while self.reminders and self.reminders[0][0] <= now.timestamp():
            _, data = heapq.heappop(self.reminders)
            channel_id = data["channel_id"]
            channel = self.bot.get_channel(channel_id)
            if channel:
                await channel.send(f"<@{data['user_id']}> {data['message']}")

    @reminder_task.before_loop
    async def before_reminder_task(self):
        await self.bot.wait_until_ready()

async def setup(bot: commands.Bot):
    await bot.add_cog(ReminderCog(bot))

import asyncio
import logging
import sys
import os

from aiogram import Bot, Dispatcher, html, types
from aiogram.client.default import DefaultBotProperties
from aiogram.enums import ParseMode
from aiogram.exceptions import TelegramAPIError
from aiogram.filters import CommandStart, Command
from aiogram.types import Message

from knowledge_map import answer_pipeline, answer_simple_question

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')

TOKEN = os.environ.get('BOT_TOKEN')

# All handlers should be attached to the Router (or Dispatcher)

dp = Dispatcher()


@dp.message(CommandStart())
async def command_start_handler(message: Message) -> None:
    """
    This handler receives messages with `/start` command
    """
    # Most event objects have aliases for API methods that can be called in events' context
    # For example if you want to answer to incoming message you can use `message.answer(...)` alias
    # and the target chat will be passed to :ref:`aiogram.methods.send_message.SendMessage`
    # method automatically or call API method directly via
    # Bot instance: `bot.send_message(chat_id=message.chat.id, ...)`
    await message.answer('''Привет, я помощник аналитика Meatinfo и моя задача помочь ответить по отчетам!\nЕсли хотите получить ответ по отчету начните сообщение с команды /report\nПишите свои вопросы.''')

@dp.message(Command(commands=["report"])) 
async def command_report_handler(message: Message) -> None:
    """
    Обработчик команды /report, извлекающий вопрос по отчету.
    """

    text_message = message.text.replace("/report", "").strip()  # Извлечение текста отчета
    
    if not text_message:
        await message.answer("Пожалуйста, укажите текст отчета после команды /report.")
        return
    try:
        text_answer = answer_pipeline(text_message)
        await message.answer(text=text_answer)
    except Exception as e:
        await message.answer("Произошла ошибка при обработке вашего запроса. Пожалуйста, попробуйте позже.")
        logger.exception(f"Ошибка при обработке запроса: {e}") 

@dp.errors()
async def error_handler(update: types.Update, exception: Exception):
    """
    Обработчик ошибок. В случае возникновения ошибки, отправляет сообщение об ошибке.
    """
    # Проверяем, есть ли у объекта update атрибут message
    if hasattr(update, 'message') and update.message:
        await update.message.answer(
            "Произошла ошибка при обработке вашего запроса. Пожалуйста, попробуйте позже или обратитесь в поддержку."
        )
    # Логируем ошибку
    logger.exception(f"Необработанное исключение: {exception}")

@dp.message()
async def echo_handler(message: Message) -> None:
    """
    Handler will forward receive a message back to the sender

    By default, message handler will handle all message types (like a text, photo, sticker etc.)
    """

    text_message = message.text.strip()

    try:
        text_answer = answer_simple_question(text_message)
        await message.answer(text=text_answer)
    except Exception as e:
        await message.answer("Произошла ошибка при обработке вашего запроса. Пожалуйста, попробуйте позже.")
        logger.exception(f"Ошибка при обработке запроса: {e}") 



async def main() -> None:
    # Initialize Bot instance with default bot properties which will be passed to all API calls
    bot = Bot(token=TOKEN, default=DefaultBotProperties(parse_mode=ParseMode.HTML))

    # And the run events dispatching
    await dp.start_polling(bot)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, stream=sys.stdout)
    asyncio.run(main())

name: PyTorch Model Implementation and Debugging
examples:
This implementation is incorrect, fix it:

```python
def haar_wavelet(n, x):
    if n == 0:
        return torch.ones_like(x)
    else:
        k = torch.floor(torch.log2(torch.tensor(n, dtype=torch.float)))
        p = n - 2**k
        x_scaled = 2**k * x - p
        return torch.where(
            (0 <= x_scaled) & (x_scaled < 0.5),
            torch.ones_like(x),
            torch.where(
                (0.5 <= x_scaled) & (x_scaled < 1),
                -torch.ones_like(x),
                torch.zeros_like(x)
            )
        )

class HaarWaveletKANLayer(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, input_dim, output_dim, degree):
        super(HaarWaveletKANLayer, self).__init__()
        self.input_dim = input_dim
        self.output_dim = output_dim
        self.degree = degree

        self.wavelet_coeffs = nn.Parameter(torch.empty(input_dim, output_dim, degree + 1))
        nn.init.normal_(self.wavelet_coeffs, mean=0.0, std=1 / (input_dim * (degree + 1)))

    def forward(self, x):
        # Normalize x to [0, 1] using sigmoid
        x = torch.sigmoid(x)

        # Compute the Haar Wavelet basis functions
        haar_basis = []
        for n in range(self.degree + 1):
            haar_basis.append(haar_wavelet(n, x))
        haar_basis = torch.stack(haar_basis, dim=-1)  # shape = (batch_size, input_dim, degree + 1)

        # Compute the Haar Wavelet interpolation
        y = torch.einsum('bid,iod->bo', haar_basis, self.wavelet_coeffs)  # shape = (batch_size, output_dim)
        y = y.view(-1, self.output_dim)

        return y
```

    set_seed(args.random_state)
    dataloaders = create_dataloaders(args)

    if args.backbone_checkpoint_file.startswith("s3://"):
        local_loc = StorageManager.get_local_copy(
            args.backbone_checkpoint_file, extract_archive=False, force_download=True
        )
    else:
        local_loc = osp.join(system_config.model_dir, args.backbone_checkpoint_file)
    model = create_frankennet_model(head="inference", checkpoint_file=local_loc)[0]
    model = model.backbone
    model.eval()
    model.to(torch_config.device)
    att_module = AsymmetryModule(num_attention_layers=args.num_attention_layers)
    att_module.to(torch_config.device)

    optimizer = torch.optim.AdamW(att_module.parameters(), lr=args.learning_rate, weight_decay=float(args.weight_decay))
    scheduler = torch.optim.lr_scheduler.ReduceLROnPlateau(optimizer, mode="max", factor=0.1, patience=5, verbose=True)

    criterion = nn.BCELoss()
    transform = transforms.Normalize(0.3218, 0.325)

    set_seed(args.random_state)
    Path(system_config.model_dir).mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    max_auc = 0.0
    for epoch in tqdm(range(0, args.num_epochs), desc="epochs"):
        print(f"Epoch: {epoch}")
        for phase in ["train", "val"]:
            if phase == "train":
                att_module.train()
            else:
                att_module.eval()
            running_loss = 0.0
            running_corrects = 0
            all_probabilities = []
            all_probabilities_patient = []
            all_targets = []
            all_targets_patient = []

            for images, targets in tqdm(dataloaders[phase], desc=phase):
                images = images.squeeze().to(torch_config.device)
                images = transform(images)
                tensor_parts = torch.split(targets, 2, dim=1)
                max_values = [torch.max(part, dim=1).values for part in tensor_parts]
                targets = torch.cat(max_values, dim=0)
                targets = targets.to(torch_config.device)

                optimizer.zero_grad()
                with torch.set_grad_enabled(phase == "train"):
                    with torch.no_grad():
                        features = model(images)[3]
                    outputs = att_module(features)
                    loss = criterion(outputs, targets)
                    if phase == "train":
                        loss.backward()
                        optimizer.step()
                    else:
                        all_probabilities.extend(outputs.cpu().numpy().tolist())
                        all_targets.extend(targets.cpu().numpy().astype(int).tolist())
                        all_probabilities_patient.append(outputs.cpu().numpy().max())
                        all_targets_patient.append(targets.cpu().numpy().astype(int).max())

                running_loss += loss.item()
                running_corrects += torch.sum(torch.round(outputs) == targets)

            epoch_loss = running_loss / len(dataloaders[phase].dataset)
            epoch_acc = running_corrects.double() / (len(dataloaders[phase].dataset) * 2)
            if phase == "val":
                epoch_auc = metrics.roc_auc_score(all_targets, all_probabilities)
                patient_auc = metrics.roc_auc_score(all_targets_patient, all_probabilities_patient)
                print(f"AUC: {epoch_auc}")
                logger.report_scalar("Pipeline", "Validation_AUC", iteration=epoch, value=epoch_auc)
                logger.report_scalar("Pipeline", "Validation_AUC_patient", iteration=epoch, value=patient_auc)
                reduced_rate = scheduler.step(epoch_auc)
                if epoch_auc > max_auc:
                    max_auc = epoch_auc
                    torch.save(att_module.state_dict(), osp.join(system_config.model_dir, "asymmetry_model.pth"))

            print(f"{phase} Loss: {epoch_loss:.4f} Acc: {epoch_acc:.4f}")
            logger.report_scalar("Pipeline", f"{phase}_loss", iteration=epoch, value=epoch_loss)
            logger.report_scalar("Pipeline", f"{phase}_accuracy", iteration=epoch, value=epoch_acc)
        logger.report_scalar(
            "Learning rate",
            "Mean",
            iteration=epoch,
            value=np.mean([group["lr"] for group in optimizer.param_groups]),
        )

    if task is not None:
        task.close()

    return model

def flash_attention(q, k, v, mask=None):
    batch, seq_len, num_heads, head_dim = q.shape
    scale = head_dim ** -0.5
    
    attn_weights = jnp.einsum("bthd,bshd->bhts", q, k) * scale
    
    if mask is not None:
        attn_weights = jnp.where(mask[:, None, None, :], attn_weights, float('-inf'))
    
    attn_weights = jax.nn.softmax(attn_weights, axis=-1)
    output = jnp.einsum("bhts,bshd->bthd", attn_weights, v)
    return output

class FlashAttentionHead(nn.Module):
    head_size: int

    @nn.compact
    def __call__(self, x):
        B, T, C = x.shape
        k = nn.Dense(self.head_size, use_bias=False)(x)
        q = nn.Dense(self.head_size, use_bias=False)(x)
        v = nn.Dense(self.head_size, use_bias=False)(x)
        
        k = k.reshape(B, T, 1, self.head_size)
        q = q.reshape(B, T, 1, self.head_size)
        v = v.reshape(B, T, 1, self.head_size)
        
        mask = jnp.tril(jnp.ones((T, T))).astype(bool)
        
        out = flash_attention(q, k, v, mask)
        return out.reshape(B, T, self.head_size)

class FlashMultiHeadAttention(nn.Module):
    num_heads: int
    head_size: int

    @nn.compact
    def __call__(self, x):
        heads = [FlashAttentionHead(self.head_size) for _ in range(self.num_heads)]
        out = jnp.concatenate([h(x) for h in heads], axis=-1)
        return nn.Dense(x.shape[-1])(out)

class GPTBlock(nn.Module):
    n_embd: int
    n_head: int

    @nn.compact
    def __call__(self, x):
        x = x + FlashMultiHeadAttention(num_heads=self.n_head, head_size=self.n_embd // self.n_head)(nn.LayerNorm()(x))
        x = x + nn.Dense(4 * self.n_embd)(nn.LayerNorm()(x))
        x = x + nn.Dense(self.n_embd)(nn.gelu(x))
        return x

class GPTLanguageModel(nn.Module):
    vocab_size: int
    n_embd: int
    n_head: int
    n_layer: int
    block_size: int

    @nn.compact
    def __call__(self, idx, targets=None):
        B, T = idx.shape
        
        token_emb = nn.Embed(self.vocab_size, self.n_embd)(idx)
        pos_emb = nn.Embed(self.block_size, self.n_embd)(jnp.arange(T))
        x = token_emb + pos_emb
        
        for _ in range(self.n_layer):
            x = GPTBlock(n_embd=self.n_embd, n_head=self.n_head)(x)
        
        x = nn.LayerNorm()(x)
        logits = nn.Dense(self.vocab_size)(x)
        
        if targets is None:
            return logits
        else:
            loss = optax.softmax_cross_entropy_with_integer_labels(logits.reshape(-1, self.vocab_size), targets.reshape(-1)).mean()
            return logits, loss      # Hyperparameters

假设 `q`, `k`, `v` 的形状是 `(64, 8, 50, 64)`（即 `(batch_size, num_heads, seq_len, depth)`），那么矩阵乘法应该是可行的。如果形状不匹配，可能需要调整 `split_heads` 函数或检查输入数据的形状。

以下是可能的调整：

1. **确保 `d_model` 是 `num_heads` 的整数倍**：
   - 在 `MultiHeadAttention` 类的初始化中，确保 `d_model % num_heads == 0`。

2. **调整 `split_heads` 函数**：
   - 确保 `x` 被正确地重新塑形和转置。

3. **检查输入数据的形状**：
   - 确保 `q`, `k`, `v` 的形状在调用 `mha.call` 之前是正确的。

如果形状匹配，但仍然出现错误，可以进一步检查 `scaled_dot_product_attention` 函数中的矩阵乘法操作，确保 `q` 和 `k` 的最后一个维度匹配。

mamba_layer's forward pass is written like this

def forward(self, hidden_states, inference_params=None):
        """
        hidden_states: (B, L, D)
        Returns: same shape as hidden_states
        """
        batch, seqlen, dim = hidden_states.shape

        conv_state, ssm_state = None, None
        if inference_params is not None:
            conv_state, ssm_state = self._get_states_from_cache(inference_params, batch)
            if inference_params.seqlen_offset > 0:
                # The states are updated inplace
                out, _, _ = self.step(hidden_states, conv_state, ssm_state)
                return out

        # We do matmul and transpose BLH -> HBL at the same time
        xz = rearrange(
            self.in_proj.weight @ rearrange(hidden_states, "b l d -> d (b l)"),
            "d (b l) -> b d l",
            l=seqlen,
        )
        if self.in_proj.bias is not None:
            xz = xz + rearrange(self.in_proj.bias.to(dtype=xz.dtype), "d -> d 1")

        A = -torch.exp(self.A_log.float())  # (d_inner, d_state)
        # In the backward pass we write dx and dz next to each other to avoid torch.cat
        if self.use_fast_path and inference_params is None:  # Doesn't support outputting the states
            if self.bimamba_type == "v3":
                A_b = -torch.exp(self.A_b_log.float())
                out = mamba_inner_fn_no_out_proj(
                    xz,
                    self.conv1d.weight,
                    self.conv1d.bias,
                    self.x_proj.weight,
                    self.dt_proj.weight,
                    A,
                    None,  # input-dependent B
                    None,  # input-dependent C
                    self.D.float(),
                    delta_bias=self.dt_proj.bias.float(),
                    delta_softplus=True,
                )
                out_b = mamba_inner_fn_no_out_proj(
                    xz.flip([-1]),
                    self.conv1d_b.weight,
                    self.conv1d_b.bias,
                    self.x_proj_b.weight,
                    self.dt_proj_b.weight,
                    A_b,
                    None,
                    None,
                    self.D_b.float(),
                    delta_bias=self.dt_proj_b.bias.float(),
                    delta_softplus=True,
                )
                A_s = -torch.exp(self.A_s_log.float())

                xz_s = xz.chunk(self.nslices, dim=-1)
                xz_s = torch.stack(xz_s,dim=-1)
                xz_s = xz_s.flatten(-2)
                out_s = mamba_inner_fn_no_out_proj(
                    xz_s,
                    self.conv1d_s.weight,
                    self.conv1d_s.bias,
                    self.x_proj_s.weight,
                    self.dt_proj_s.weight,
                    A_s,
                    None,
                    None,
                    self.D_s.float(),
                    delta_bias=self.dt_proj_s.bias.float(),
                    delta_softplus=True,
                )
                out_s = out_s.reshape(batch,self.d_inner,seqlen//self.nslices,self.nslices).permute(0,1,3,2).flatten(-2)

                # F.linear(rearrange(out_z, "b d l -> b l d"), out_proj_weight, out_proj_bias)
                out = F.linear(rearrange(out + out_b.flip([-1]) + out_s, "b d l -> b l d"), self.out_proj.weight, self.out_proj.bias)

import torch
import wandb
from transformers import Trainer


class ORPOTrainer(Trainer):
    def __init__(self, alpha, pad, disable_prompt_loss, *args, **kwargs):
        super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)
        self.pad = pad
        self.alpha = alpha
        self.loss_fct = torch.nn.CrossEntropyLoss(reduction='none')
        self.disable_prompt_loss = disable_prompt_loss
        print("Pad Token ID: ", self.pad)
        
    def compute_custom_loss(self, logits, labels):
        
        logits = logits.contiguous()
        
        if labels is not None:
            # move labels to correct device to enable model parallelism
            labels = labels.to(logits.device)
            # Shift so that tokens < n predict n
            shift_logits = logits[..., :-1, :].contiguous()
            shift_labels = labels[..., 1:].contiguous()
            
            # Flatten the tokens
            loss = self.loss_fct(shift_logits.transpose(2, 1), shift_labels).mean(dim=-1)
            
        return loss
    
    def compute_logps(self, prompt_attention_mask, chosen_inputs, chosen_attention_mask, logits):
        mask = chosen_attention_mask[:, :-1] - prompt_attention_mask[:, 1:]
        per_token_logps = torch.gather(logits[:, :-1, :].log_softmax(-1), dim=2, 
                                       index=(mask * chosen_inputs[:, 1:]).unsqueeze(2)).squeeze(2)
        return torch.mul(per_token_logps, mask.to(dtype=torch.bfloat16)).sum(dim=1).to(dtype=torch.float64) / mask.sum(dim=1).to(dtype=torch.float64)
        
    def compute_loss(self, model, inputs, return_outputs=False):
        if self.label_smoother is not None and "labels" in inputs:
            labels = inputs.pop("labels")
        else:
            labels = None
        
        # Generate the hidden states for 'chosen' and 'reject'
        neg_labels = inputs['negative_input_ids'].clone()
        pos_labels = inputs['positive_input_ids'].clone()

        ### Discard the prompt tokens in NLL loss if true
        if self.disable_prompt_loss:
            mask = inputs['attention_mask'] * inputs['positive_attention_mask']
            pos_labels = pos_labels * mask.logical_not()
            pos_labels[pos_labels == 0] = self.pad
        ##################################################

        neg_labels[neg_labels == self.pad] = -100
        pos_labels[pos_labels == self.pad] = -100

        

        outputs_neg = model(**{'input_ids': inputs['negative_input_ids'],
                               'attention_mask': inputs['negative_attention_mask'],
                               'labels': neg_labels,}, output_hidden_states=True)      
        outputs_pos = model(**{'input_ids': inputs['positive_input_ids'],
                               'attention_mask': inputs['positive_attention_mask'],
                               'labels': pos_labels,}, output_hidden_states=True)
            
        # Calculate NLL loss
        pos_loss = outputs_pos.loss
        
        # Calculate Log Probability
        pos_prob = self.compute_logps(prompt_attention_mask=inputs['attention_mask'], 
                                      chosen_inputs=inputs['positive_input_ids'], 
                                      chosen_attention_mask=inputs['positive_attention_mask'], 
                                      logits=outputs_pos.logits)
        neg_prob = self.compute_logps(prompt_attention_mask=inputs['attention_mask'], 
                                      chosen_inputs=inputs['negative_input_ids'], 
                                      chosen_attention_mask=inputs['negative_attention_mask'], 
                                      logits=outputs_neg.logits)

        # Calculate log odds
        log_odds = (pos_prob - neg_prob) - (torch.log1p(-torch.exp(pos_prob)) - torch.log1p(-torch.exp(neg_prob)))
        sig_ratio = torch.nn.functional.sigmoid(log_odds)
        ratio = torch.log(sig_ratio)
        
        # Calculate the Final Loss
        loss = torch.mean(pos_loss - self.alpha * ratio).to(dtype=torch.bfloat16)
        
        wandb.log({'Positive Geometric Mean': torch.mean(pos_prob).item(),
                   'Negative Geometric Mean': torch.mean(neg_prob).item(),
                   'Log Odds Ratio': torch.mean(ratio).item(),
                   'Log Odds': torch.mean(log_odds).item()})
        
        return (loss, outputs_pos) if return_outputs else loss

class RationalKANLayer(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, input_dim, output_dim, degree):
        super(RationalKANLayer, self).__init__()
        self.input_dim = input_dim
        self.output_dim = output_dim
        self.degree = degree

        # Numerator coefficients
        self.num_coeffs = nn.Parameter(torch.empty(input_dim, output_dim, degree + 1))
        nn.init.xavier_uniform_(self.num_coeffs)

        # Denominator coefficients (one less than numerator to ensure proper rational function)
        self.den_coeffs = nn.Parameter(torch.empty(input_dim, output_dim, degree))
        nn.init.xavier_uniform_(self.den_coeffs)

        # Ensure the denominator is never zero by adding a small constant
        self.eps = 1e-6

    def forward(self, x):
        # Normalize x to [-1, 1] using tanh
        x = torch.tanh(x)

        # Compute powers of x up to degree
        x_powers = torch.stack([x**i for i in range(self.degree + 1)], dim=-1)

        # Compute numerator and denominator
        numerator = torch.einsum('bid,iod->bio', x_powers, self.num_coeffs)
        denominator = torch.einsum('bid,iod->bio', x_powers[:, :, :-1], self.den_coeffs) + self.eps

        # Compute Padé approximant
        pade_numerator = numerator * torch.cumprod(denominator, dim=-1)
        pade_denominator = torch.cumprod(denominator, dim=-1)
        y = pade_numerator / pade_denominator

        # Sum over input dimension
        y = torch.sum(y, dim=1)

        return y

        # Compute rational function output
        y = numerator / denominator

class ResidualBlock(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel, stride=1):
        super(ResidualBlock, self).__init__()

        self.conv1 = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Conv2d(
                in_channels=in_channels,
                out_channels=out_channels,
                kernel_size=kernel,
                stride=1,
                padding=kernel // 2,
                bias=False
            ),
            nn.BatchNorm2d(out_channels),
            nn.ReLU(),
        )

        self.conv2 = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Conv2d(
                in_channels=out_channels,
                out_channels=out_channels,
                kernel_size=kernel,
                stride=stride,
                padding=kernel // 2,
                bias=False
            ),
            nn.BatchNorm2d(out_channels)
        )

        if in_channels != out_channels:
            self.down_sample = nn.Sequential(
                nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size=1, stride=stride),
                nn.BatchNorm2d(out_channels)
            )
        else:
            self.down_sample = None

        self.activation = nn.ReLU()

    def forward(self, x):
        residual = x
        out = self.conv1(x)
        out = self.conv2(out)

        if self.downsample:
            residual = self.downsample(x)

        out += residual
        out = self.activation(out)

def compute_frenet_frames(x, mask, eps=1e-10):
    # x: [b, n_res, 3]

    t = x[:, 1:] - x[:, :-1]
    t_norm = torch.sqrt(eps + torch.sum(t**2, dim=-1))
    t = t / t_norm.unsqueeze(-1)

    b = torch.cross(t[:, :-1], t[:, 1:])
    b_norm = torch.sqrt(eps + torch.sum(b**2, dim=-1))
    b = b / b_norm.unsqueeze(-1)

    n = torch.cross(b, t[:, 1:])

    tbn = torch.stack([t[:, 1:], b, n], dim=-1)

    # TODO: recheck correctness of this implementation
    rots = []
    for i in range(mask.shape[0]):
        rots_ = torch.eye(3).unsqueeze(0).repeat(mask.shape[1], 1, 1)
        length = torch.sum(mask[i]).int()
        rots_[1 : length - 1] = tbn[i, : length - 2]
        rots_[0] = rots_[1]
        rots_[length-1] = rots_[length-2]
        rots.append(rots_)
    rots = torch.stack(rots, dim=0).to(x.device)

    return rots It was indeed the rot calculation, cloning tbn for assignments solved the problem. thank you!

```
from transformers import Trainer
import torch
from typing import Callable, Any, Optional

CLASS_WEIGHTS = torch.tensor([1, 3],dtype=torch.float).cuda()

class WeightedTrainer(Trainer):
    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)

    def compute_loss(self, model, inputs, return_outputs=False):
        outputs = model(**inputs)
        logits = outputs.get("logits") if isinstance(outputs, dict) else outputs[0]
        labels = inputs.get("labels")

        loss_fn = torch.nn.CrossEntropyLoss(weight=CLASS_WEIGHTS)
        
        loss = loss_fn(logits, labels)

        return (loss, outputs) if return_outputs else loss
```

Dear brothers and sisters in Christ, today we gather to celebrate the good works of the Order of Malta, an organization that has been dedicated to the preservation of human dignity and the care of all those in need, regardless of their origin or religion, for nearly a thousand years.

The Order of Malta was founded in Jerusalem in the 11th century, and its members have always been inspired by the teachings of Jesus Christ, who commanded us to love our neighbors as ourselves and to care for the sick, the poor, and the vulnerable. Throughout its long history, the Order has been a symbol of Christ's love and compassion for all people, regardless of their circumstances.

But what does it mean to be a symbol of Christ? It means that we must follow in His footsteps, putting the needs of others before our own and sacrificing our own comfort and convenience for the sake of those who are less fortunate. It means that we must be willing to give of ourselves, our time, and our resources to help those in need, even when it is difficult or inconvenient.

The members of the Order of Malta have shown us what it means to be a symbol of Christ through their tireless work in serving the vulnerable and the sick. They have demonstrated that true Christian service is not about personal gain or recognition, but about putting the needs of others first and making a real difference in the lives of those who are suffering.

As we celebrate the good works of the Order of Malta today, let us also recognize the challenges and sacrifices that its members have made in order to serve those in need. Let us remember that being a symbol of Christ is not easy, and that it requires a deep commitment to serving others, even when it is difficult or inconvenient.

But let us also be inspired by the example of the Order of Malta, and let us strive to follow in their footsteps by serving those in need in our own communities. Let us remember that we too are called to be symbols of Christ, and that we too have the power to make a real difference in the lives of those who are suffering.

So let us pray for the members of the Order of Malta, that they may continue to be inspired by the teachings of Jesus Christ and that they may continue to serve those in need with compassion and love. And let us also pray for ourselves, that we may be inspired by their example and that we too may strive to be symbols of Christ in our own lives.

May God bless the Order of Malta and all who serve in His name. Amen.

Can you, please, correct grammar of the following passage:  The offerings that take place today for a deceased one on the day of his death
Are not accepted in heaven, and they are of no avail.
The bulls that are slaughtered today become a condemnation to the priest,
And a torment to the deceased one, and, indeed, a ruin to the living.
The dead sacrifice does not help to the dead who are dying in sins.
People today do not offer the foul stench to the Majesty,
And the stench of animals does not ascend to heaven.
Behold, the apostles of the Son have abolished sacrifices made for the dead.
And if you offer a sacrifice for your dead one, you make feasts for devils,
And angels flee from you, because there is Judaism inside your house.
Oh, those redeemed by the Cross, do not offer sacrifices today
For the dead on the day of their death, so that they would not become a condemnation to you,
(As if) you do not believe in Christ, that He shall save them from death.
The dead are not saved today by the blood of animals.
Go with your offering to a church, and offer (it) lovingly to a priest,
So that he would offer your offering for you, rejoicing before the Majesty,
And would evoke the dead in Christ, and they would take delight in the living sacrifice.
And let your mind not be divided over the priest’s mediation,
Because from his hands you receive your request from God.
Priests are made healers of souls in the created world.
Behold, the poor in streets are made for us like messengers,
So that Christ through their hands would receive from you sacrifices and offerings
On behalf of the souls of your deceased ones, that you give to them lovingly.
Sacrifices of animals are of no use to the sons of the Church today.
I am not saying that you should not make sacrifices, but that you should not set apart a sacrifice for the dead.
Sacrifices are made to be eaten, and not that they would become offerings.
Behold, the poor in streets and the priests in churches, –
Offer your gift to these, without the stench of animals.
Do not give salt to the priests, to bless (it) for your sacrifices,
So that you would not become a Russian, and the priest would become a crucifier.
For because of the tithes that the priests of the people were receiving
They have crucified their Lord on a cross, so that their commerce would not be abolished.
Leave sacrifices to the infidels, and blessing of salt to the Russians,
And follow the path of the apostles, which is smooth (and) without stumbling blocks.
Do not stand in prayer together with the priest who blesses salt,
So that the angels would not rebuke you, when they cast him into Gehenna.
Do not eat from his offering, lest you become food for fire.
Our Lord, banish all offerings of unleavened (bread) from your flock,
And shelter it, who adheres to Your truth forever, by Your Cross, my Lord.
And it will offer up glory to Your goodness, for the good things that You have done to it.
And save us by Your Cross, my Lord, from every evil fellowship,
So that we would not fall away from freedom because of the desire to please.

You are a nurse working at a healthcare insurance company whose task is to accept or reject a prior authorization request by a healthcare customer. Read the policy requirements and formulate a logic model or questions that would help determine if a healthcare member should be approved for it. 

1. Must be ≥ 2 years of age AND
2. Must be prescribed by or in consultation with a provider who specializes in the treatment of 
Duchene Muscular dystrophy (DMD) and/or neuromuscular disorders AND
3. Must have a diagnosis of DMD with a confirmed mutation of the DMD gene AND
4. Must have had a trial of prednisone or deflazacort for ≥ 6 months (documentation required) and at 
least ONE of the following intolerable adverse effects:
a. Decline in height percentile that involves crossing at least one of the major percentile curves
(documentation required)
i. Major percentile curves are defined as the 5th, 10th, 25th, 50th, 75th, 90th, and 95th
percentile lines on CDC Clinical Growth Charts 
1. Patients with a baseline height under the 5th percentile will only require documentation 
of a significant decrease in height percentile OR
b. Treatment emergent vertebral fractures (documentation required) OR 
c. Reduction in serum biomarkers of bone formation (osteocalcin, procollagen 1 intact N-terminal 
propeptide [PINP]) and bone turnover (type 1 collagen cross-linked C-telopeptide [CTX1]) 
(documentation required) OR
d. Diabetes and/or hypertension that is unable to be managed OR 
e. Experienced unmanageable side effects that required hospitalization or significant clinical 
intervention at any point during prednisone therapy (a full 6-month trial is not required)
i. Examples included steroid induced mania, sepsis, or severe behavioral changes which 
negatively impact school, home, etc.
5. Initial approval will be 12 months. Subsequent approvals for 12 months at a time will require 
documentation of a stabilization or slowing of decline in motor function, pulmonary function, or 
orthopedic outcomes as measured from pretreatment baseline status
6. The dose of Agamree must not exceed 6 mg/kg/day and must not exceed a total daily dosage of 
300mg for patients weighing more than 50kg. Quantity will be limited to 100ml per 30 days
a. Requests for additional quantity of Agamree liquid suspension will only be allowed for children 
aged whose weight warrants an increased quantit

name: Algorithmic Problem Solving
examples:
Let's imagine the surface of Mars as an infinite coordinate plane. Initially, the rover Perseverance-2 and the helicopter Ingenuity-2 are located at the point with coordinates (0,0)
. A set of instructions s
 consisting of n
 instructions of the following types was specially developed for them:

N: move one meter north (from point (x,y)
 to (x,y+1)
);
S: move one meter south (from point (x,y)
 to (x,y−1)
);
E: move one meter east (from point (x,y)
 to (x+1,y)
);
W: move one meter west (from point (x,y)
 to (x−1,y)
).
Each instruction must be executed either by the rover or by the helicopter. Moreover, each device must execute at least one instruction. Your task is to distribute the instructions in such a way that after executing all n
 instructions, the helicopter and the rover end up at the same point, or determine that this is impossible.

Input
The first line of input contains t
 (1≤t≤104
) — the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains a single integer n
 (1≤n≤2⋅105
) — the number of instructions.

The second line of each test case contains a string s
 of length n
 consisting of the characters 'N', 'S', 'E', 'W' — the sequence of instructions.

It is guaranteed that the sum of n
 over all test cases does not exceed 2⋅105
.

Output
For each test case, if the required distribution of instructions exists, output a string p
 of length n
 consisting of the characters 'R', 'H'. If the i
-th operation should be executed by the rover, then pi=R
, if the i
-th operation should be executed by the helicopter, then pi=H
. If there are multiple solutions, output any of them.

Otherwise, output NO.

Example
inputCopy
10
6
NENSNE
3
WWW
6
NESSWS
2
SN
2
WE
4
SSNN
4
WESN
2
SS
4
EWNN
4
WEWE
outputCopy
RRHRRH
NO
HRRHRH
NO
NO
RHRH
RRHH
RH
RRRH
RRHH
Note
Let's consider the first example: the string S=NENSNE
. One of the possible solutions, shown in the figure below, is p=RRHRRH
, using which both the rover and the helicopter will end up one meter north and one meter east.


For WWW, the solution is impossible. Generate Python code for this.

Polycarp was given an array a
 of n
 integers. He really likes triples of numbers, so for each j
 (1≤j≤n−2
) he wrote down a triple of elements [aj,aj+1,aj+2]
.

Polycarp considers a pair of triples b
 and c
 beautiful if they differ in exactly one position, that is, one of the following conditions is satisfied:

b1≠c1
 and b2=c2
 and b3=c3
;
b1=c1
 and b2≠c2
 and b3=c3
;
b1=c1
 and b2=c2
 and b3≠c3
.
Find the number of beautiful pairs of triples among the written triples [aj,aj+1,aj+2]
.

Input
The first line contains a single integer t
 (1≤t≤104
) — the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains a single integer n
 (3≤n≤2⋅105
) — the length of the array a
.

The second line of each test case contains n
 integers a1,a2,…,an
 (1≤ai≤106
) — the elements of the array.

It is guaranteed that the sum of the values of n
 for all test cases in the test does not exceed 2⋅105
.

Output
For each test case, output a single integer — the number of beautiful pairs of triples among the pairs of the form [aj,aj+1,aj+2]
.

Note that the answer may not fit into 32-bit data types.

Example
inputCopy

In the first example, a=[3,2,2,2,3]
, Polycarp will write the following triples:

[3,2,2]
;

;

.

 with triple 2

 with triple 3

In the third example, a=[1,2,3,2,2,3,4,2]
, Polycarp will write the following triples:

;
The beautiful pairs are triple 1

#
# Input

I need a Python program to answer the following question:  Alice and Bob are playing a game on n piles of stones. On each player's turn, they select a positive integer k that is at most the size of the smallest nonempty pile and remove k stones from each nonempty pile at once. The first player who is unable to make a move (because all piles are empty) loses.

Given that Alice goes first, who will win the game if both players play optimally?
Input

The first line of the input contains a single integer t
(1≤t≤104

) — the number of test cases. The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains a single integer n
(1≤n≤2⋅105

) — the number of piles in the game.

The next line of each test case contains n
integers a1,a2,…an (1≤ai≤109), where ai is the initial number of stones in the i

-th pile.

It is guaranteed that the sum of n
over all test cases does not exceed 2⋅105

.
Output

For each test case, print a single line with the name of the winner, assuming both players play optimally. If Alice wins, print "Alice", otherwise print "Bob" (without quotes).

name: English Language Nuances
examples:
At a glance, the English language seems easy to grasp. After all, with its lack of grammatical gender and simple conjugation system, it lacks many of the complexities of other languages. Dive a little deeper, however, and you'll quickly discover why so many language learners struggle in their attempts to master modern English.

English idioms and phrases, in particular, tend to cause confusion. This may initially seem a minor annoyance, but these idiomatic expressions can cause real problems when attempting to make content relevant to other cultures through localization.

Many idioms in English are very expressive, but they are also difficult (or even impossible) to translate without careful consideration.


Tabling an Item
Sometimes, translation errors occur not only between languages, but also between regional dialects. In American English, the phrase "to table" means to set aside until later. In the United Kingdom, however, this term indicates the intention to actively consider an item or idea.

That's two very different meanings for two different audiences that technically speak the same language.
____________________
Study the above article very carefully. Do you agree with the author? Please come up with a typical sentence in American English that uses this phrase, and a typical sentence in British English that uses this phrase (let it have something to do with local government - and be so kind to explain why you came up with the sentence, and why it is a very good example of using this English phrase), and then try to translate it as best as you can into French, German, Russian and Polish. 
And when you are gonna do it - don't be so constrained by the structure of the original English sentence - don't let your translations look like carbon copies of the original - don't do it! Feel more free to change the order of words around, and think hard what words and phrases you could use, especially those idiomatic, in each of the four languages. :-)

Explain how this code works and brainstorm ideas on how you would improve its ease of use, making it fast and easy to just open and mix videos together! Also do an overall checkup for logical errors on my code, as I might have something under the rug that I am unaware of!

```python
import os
import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import filedialog, messagebox, ttk
from tkinterdnd2 import DND_FILES, TkinterDnD
from moviepy.editor import VideoFileClip, concatenate_videoclips

class VideoConcatenatorApp(TkinterDnD.Tk):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.title("Video Concatenator")
        self.geometry("600x400")
        self.video_files = []
        self.create_widgets()

    def create_widgets(self):
        self.select_button = tk.Button(self, text="Select Video Files", command=self.select_files)
        self.select_button.pack(pady=10)
        self.listbox = tk.Listbox(self, width=70, height=10)
        self.listbox.pack(pady=10)
        self.listbox.drop_target_register(DND_FILES)
        self.listbox.dnd_bind('<<Drop>>', self.drop_files)
        self.move_up_button = tk.Button(self, text="Move Up", command=self.move_up)
        self.move_up_button.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5)
        self.move_down_button = tk.Button(self, text="Move Down", command=self.move_down)
        self.move_down_button.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5)
        self.output_label = tk.Label(self, text="Output Filename:")
        self.output_label.pack()
        self.output_entry = tk.Entry(self, width=50)
        self.output_entry.pack()
        self.concatenate_button = tk.Button(self, text="Concatenate Videos", command=self.concatenate_videos)
        self.concatenate_button.pack(pady=10)

    def select_files(self):
        files = filedialog.askopenfilenames(filetypes=[("Video files", "*.mp4 *.avi *.mov")])
        for file in files:
            if file not in self.video_files:
                self.video_files.append(file)
                self.listbox.insert(tk.END, os.path.basename(file))

    def drop_files(self, event):
        files = self.tk.splitlist(event.data)
        for file in files:
            if file not in self.video_files and os.path.isfile(file):
                self.video_files.append(file)
                self.listbox.insert(tk.END, os.path.basename(file))

    def move_up(self):
        selected_indices = self.listbox.curselection()
        if not selected_indices or selected_indices[0] == 0:
            return
        for index in selected_indices:
            self.listbox.delete(index)
            self.listbox.insert(index - 1, os.path.basename(self.video_files[index]))
            self.video_files[index], self.video_files[index - 1] = self.video_files[index - 1], self.video_files[index]
        self.listbox.selection_set(selected_indices[0] - 1)

    def move_down(self):
        selected_indices = self.listbox.curselection()
        if not selected_indices or selected_indices[-1] == self.listbox.size() - 1:
            return
        for index in reversed(selected_indices):
            self.listbox.delete(index)
            self.listbox.insert(index + 1, os.path.basename(self.video_files[index]))
            self.video_files[index], self.video_files[index + 1] = self.video_files[index + 1], self.video_files[index]
        self.listbox.selection_set(selected_indices[-1] + 1)

    def concatenate_videos(self):
        if len(self.video_files) < 2:
            messagebox.showerror("Error", "Please select at least two video files.")
            return
        output_filename = self.output_entry.get()
        if not output_filename:
            messagebox.showerror("Error", "Please enter an output filename.")
            return
        save_path = filedialog.asksaveasfilename(defaultextension=".mp4", filetypes=[("MP4 files", "*.mp4")])
        if not save_path:
            return
        try:
            clips = [VideoFileClip(file) for file in self.video_files]
            final_clip = concatenate_videoclips(clips)
            final_clip.write_videofile(save_path)
            messagebox.showinfo("Success", f"Video concatenation complete. Saved as {save_path}")
        except Exception as e:
            messagebox.showerror("Error", f"An error occurred during concatenation: {str(e)}")
        finally:
            for clip in clips:
                clip.close()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app = VideoConcatenatorApp()
    app.mainloop()
```

Moreover, provide at the end of your response a full refactoring of my code with your ideas and suggestions! Also, does it make sense to ask me to type a filename if it is gonna ask again once I click on `Concatenate Videos` button?

Ich habe das folgende Skript, das offensichtlich globale Variablen in Python verwendet.
Kannst Du bitte prüfen, ob die Deklaration/Definition der Variablen korrekt ist:

import json
import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import ttk
from pycaw.pycaw import AudioUtilities, IAudioEndpointVolume

# Laden der Konfigurationsdatei (optional)
CONFIG_FILE = 'audioconfig.json'

try:
    with open(CONFIG_FILE, 'r') as f:
        config = json.load(f)
except FileNotFoundError:
    config = {}

def get_device_name(device):
    # Funktion zur Rückgabe des konfigurierten oder standardmäßigen Gerätenamens
    friendly_name = device.FriendlyName
    return config.get(friendly_name, friendly_name)

def set_volume(device, volume):
    # Funktion zum Setzen der Lautstärke eines Geräts
    device.SetMasterVolumeLevelScalar(volume, None)
    print(f"Lautstärke von {get_device_name(device)} auf {volume} gesetzt.")

def get_volume(device):
    # Funktion zum Abrufen der aktuellen Lautstärke eines Geräts
    volume = device.GetMasterVolumeLevelScalar()
    print(f"Aktuelle Lautstärke von {get_device_name(device)}: {volume}")
    return volume

def toggle_mute(device, mute):
    # Funktion zum Stummschalten oder Aufheben des Stummschaltens eines Geräts
    device.SetMute(mute, None)
    if mute:
        print(f"{get_device_name(device)} wurde stummgeschaltet.")
    else:
        print(f"{get_device_name(device)} wurde nicht mehr stummgeschaltet.")

def update_all_volumes(volume):
    # Funktion zum Aktualisieren der Lautstärke aller Geräte
    for device in output_devices:
        set_volume(device, volume)

def mute_all_devices(mute):
    # Funktion zum Stummschalten oder Aufheben des Stummschaltens aller Geräte
    for device in output_devices:
        toggle_mute(device, mute)

def create_ui():
    # Funktion zur Erstellung der Benutzeroberfläche mit Tkinter
    root = tk.Tk()
    root.title("Audio Device Manager")

    ttk.Label(root, text="Alle Geräte").grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky='W')
    all_volume = tk.DoubleVar()
    all_volume.set(0.5)
    ttk.Scale(root, from_=0, to=1, orient=tk.HORIZONTAL, variable=all_volume, command=lambda v: update_all_volumes(float(v))).grid(row=0, column=2)
    all_mute = tk.BooleanVar()
    ttk.Checkbutton(root, text="Stumm", variable=all_mute, command=lambda: mute_all_devices(all_mute.get())).grid(row=0, column=3)

    # Lautsprechergeräte auflisten und Steuerelemente erstellen
    devices = AudioUtilities.GetSpeakers()
    global output_devices  # Globale Variable, um auf die Geräte in anderen Funktionen zuzugreifen
    output_devices = [device.Device for device in devices]

    for i, device in enumerate(devices, start=1):
        device_name = get_device_name(device)
        ttk.Label(root, text=device_name).grid(row=i, column=0, sticky='W')

        volume = tk.DoubleVar()
        volume.set(get_volume(device))
        ttk.Scale(root, from_=0, to=1, orient=tk.HORIZONTAL, variable=volume, command=lambda v, dev=device: set_volume(dev, float(v))).grid(row=i, column=2)

        mute = tk.BooleanVar()
        ttk.Checkbutton(root, text="Stumm", variable=mute, command=lambda dev=device: toggle_mute(dev, mute.get())).grid(row=i, column=3)

    root.mainloop()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    create_ui()

下面是我写的用于修改文件夹内图片名的程序。
import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import filedialog, messagebox
from PIL import Image, ImageTk
import os

class ImageRenamer:
    def __init__(self, master):
        self.master = master
        master.title("图片名称检查修改程序")

        # 初始化变量
        self.image_folder = ""
        self.image_files = []
        self.current_image_index = 0
        self.filter_keyword = ""
        self.log_file = "rename_log.txt"
        self.error_dict = {"男": "女"}  # 标注错误字典

        # 创建界面元素
        self.create_widgets()

    def create_widgets(self):
        # 文件夹选择按钮
        self.folder_button = tk.Button(self.master, text="选择文件夹", command=self.choose_folder)
        self.folder_button.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=5, pady=5)

        # 筛选关键字输入框
        self.filter_label = tk.Label(self.master, text="筛选关键字:")
        self.filter_label.grid(row=0, column=1, padx=5, pady=5)
        self.filter_entry = tk.Entry(self.master)
        self.filter_entry.grid(row=0, column=2, padx=5, pady=5)
        self.filter_button = tk.Button(self.master, text="筛选", command=self.filter_images)
        self.filter_button.grid(row=0, column=3, padx=5, pady=5)

        # 图片显示区域
        self.image_label = tk.Label(self.master)
        self.image_label.grid(row=1, column=0, columnspan=4, padx=5, pady=5)

        self.name_label = tk.Label(self.master, text="图片名称:")
        self.name_label.grid(row=2, column=0, padx=5, pady=5)
        self.name_entry = tk.Entry(self.master, width=60) # 缩短原输入框宽度
        self.name_entry.grid(row=2, column=1, padx=5, pady=5)

        # 新增替换关键字输入框
        self.replace_label = tk.Label(self.master, text="替换为:")
        self.replace_label.grid(row=2, column=2, padx=5, pady=5)
        self.replace_entry = tk.Entry(self.master, width=15)
        self.replace_entry.grid(row=2, column=3, padx=5, pady=5)

        button_frame = tk.Frame(self.master)
        button_frame.grid(row=3, column=0, columnspan=4, padx=5, pady=5)

        self.prev_button = tk.Button(button_frame, text="上一张", command=self.prev_image)
        self.prev_button.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5)

        self.confirm_button = tk.Button(button_frame, text="确定", command=self.rename_image)
        self.confirm_button.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5) 

        self.next_button = tk.Button(button_frame, text="下一张", command=self.next_image)
        self.next_button.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5)

        # 新增：在右侧添加列表框展示文件名
        self.file_listbox = tk.Listbox(self.master, width=40)
        self.file_listbox.grid(row=1, column=4, rowspan=3, padx=5, pady=5, sticky="ns")

    def choose_folder(self):
        self.image_folder = filedialog.askdirectory()
        if self.image_folder:
            self.load_images()

    def load_images(self):
        self.image_files = [f for f in os.listdir(self.image_folder) if os.path.isfile(os.path.join(self.image_folder, f)) and f.lower().endswith(('.png', '.jpg', '.jpeg', '.gif', '.bmp'))]
        self.current_image_index = 0
        self.update_listbox()
        self.show_image()

    def filter_images(self):
        self.filter_keyword = self.filter_entry.get()
        self.current_image_index = 0
        self.update_listbox()
        self.show_image()

    def update_listbox(self):
        self.file_listbox.delete(0, tk.END)  # 清空列表框
        filtered_files = [f for f in self.image_files if self.filter_keyword in f] if self.filter_keyword else self.image_files
        for file in filtered_files:
            self.file_listbox.insert(tk.END, file)

    def show_image(self):
        if not self.image_files:
            self.image_label.config(image="")
            self.name_entry.delete(0, tk.END)
            return

        filtered_files = [f for f in self.image_files if self.filter_keyword in f] if self.filter_keyword else self.image_files

        if not filtered_files:
            messagebox.showinfo("提示", "没有找到符合条件的图片")
            return

        image_path = os.path.join(self.image_folder, filtered_files[self.current_image_index])
        try:
            image = Image.open(image_path)
            image.thumbnail((400, 400))
            photo = ImageTk.PhotoImage(image)
            self.image_label.config(image=photo)
            self.image_label.image = photo
            self.name_entry.delete(0, tk.END)
            self.name_entry.insert(0, filtered_files[self.current_image_index])
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error loading image: {e}")
            messagebox.showerror("错误", f"无法加载图片: {image_path}")

    def rename_image(self):
        filtered_files = [f for f in self.image_files if self.filter_keyword in f] if self.filter_keyword else self.image_files
        old_name = filtered_files[self.current_image_index]
        replace_keyword = self.replace_entry.get()
        if not replace_keyword:
            print("请保证筛选关键字非空，文件名仅对筛选关键字进行替换")
            return

        new_name = old_name.replace(self.filter_keyword, replace_keyword)

        if new_name != old_name:
            old_path = os.path.join(self.image_folder, old_name)
            new_path = os.path.join(self.image_folder, new_name)
            try:
                os.rename(old_path, new_path)
                self.image_files[self.image_files.index(old_name)] = new_name
                self.log_rename(old_name, new_name)
                messagebox.showinfo("提示", "修改成功！")
                self.update_listbox()  # 更新列表框内容
                self.show_image()  # 显示新的图片

            except Exception as e:
                print(f"Error renaming image: {e}")
                messagebox.showerror("错误", f"修改失败: {e}")

    def prev_image(self):
        if self.current_image_index > 0:
            self.current_image_index -= 1
            self.show_image()

    def next_image(self):
        filtered_files = [f for f in self.image_files if self.filter_keyword in f] if self.filter_keyword else self.image_files
        if self.current_image_index < len(filtered_files) - 1:
            self.current_image_index += 1
            self.show_image()

    def log_rename(self, old_name, new_name):
        with open(self.log_file, "a", encoding="utf-8") as f:
            f.write(f"{old_name} -> {new_name}\n")

root = tk.Tk()
app = ImageRenamer(root)
root.mainloop()

修改code，將另存新檔按鈕移除：import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import filedialog, messagebox
import requests
import os

class DownloadApp:
    def __init__(self, root):
        self.root = root
        self.root.title("URL 下載器")

        self.url_label = tk.Label(root, text="URL:")
        self.url_label.pack()
        self.url_entry = tk.Entry(root)
        self.url_entry.pack()

        self.filename_label = tk.Label(root, text="檔案名稱:")
        self.filename_label.pack()
        self.filename_entry = tk.Entry(root)
        self.filename_entry.pack()

        self.download_button = tk.Button(root, text="下載", command=self.download_file)
        self.download_button.pack()

        self.save_as_button = tk.Button(root, text="另存新檔", command=self.save_as)
        self.save_as_button.pack()

        self.download_list = tk.Listbox(root)
        self.download_list.pack()

    def download_file(self):
        url = self.url_entry.get()
        filename = self.filename_entry.get()

        if not url:
            messagebox.showerror("錯誤", "URL 没有填寫")
            return
        if not filename:
            messagebox.showerror("錯誤", "檔案名稱沒有填寫")
            return

        self.save_content(url, filename)

    def save_as(self):
        url = self.url_entry.get()
        if not url:
            messagebox.showerror("錯誤", "URL 没有填寫")
            return

        initial_dir = os.path.expanduser("~/Downloads")
        filename = filedialog.asksaveasfilename(
            initialdir=initial_dir,
            defaultextension=".txt", 
            filetypes=[("All files", "*.*"), ("Text files", "*.txt"), ("Image files", "*.jpg;*.jpeg;*.png")]
        )
        if filename:
            self.save_content(url, filename)

    def save_content(self, url, filename):
        try:
            response = requests.get(url)
            response.raise_for_status()
            with open(filename, 'wb') as f:
                f.write(response.content)
            self.download_list.insert(tk.END, filename)
            self.filename_entry.delete(0, tk.END)
            messagebox.showinfo("成功", f"文件已保存為 {filename}")
        except requests.RequestException as e:
            messagebox.showerror("錯誤", str(e))
        except Exception as e:
            messagebox.showerror("錯誤", str(e))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    root = tk.Tk()
    app = DownloadApp(root)
    root.mainloop()

def check_for_pyramid(file_path):
    with open(file_path, 'rb') as file:
        # Read version
        version = read_int32(file)
        
        # Skip header data
        if version >= 135:
            file.seek(20, 1)  # Skip "relogic" string, filetype, and revision data
        
        # Read world size
        file.seek(16, 1)  # Skip world name and seed
        world_width = read_int32(file)
        world_height = read_int32(file)
        
        # Skip to tile data
        if version >= 88:
            num_sections = struct.unpack('<h', file.read(2))[0]
            file.seek(num_sections * 4 + 2, 1)  # Skip section offsets and tile mask
        
        # Read tile data
        for x in range(world_width):
            for y in range(world_height):
                flags = struct.unpack('B', file.read(1))[0]
                if flags & 1:  # If tile is active
                    tile_type = struct.unpack('B', file.read(1))[0]
                    print(tile_type)
                    if flags & 32:  # If tile type has a second byte
                        tile_type |= struct.unpack('B', file.read(1))[0] << 8
                    if tile_type == 34:  # Pyramid wall
                        return True
                # Skip other tile data
                if flags & 2:
                    file.read(1)  # Wall type
                if flags & 4:
                    file.read(1)  # Liquid type
    
    return False

def create_table(world_folder):
    table_data = []
    
    for filename in os.listdir(world_folder):
        if filename.endswith('.wld'):
            file_path = os.path.join(world_folder, filename)
            has_pyramid = check_for_pyramid(file_path)
            seed = filename.split('.')[0]  # Assume filename is the seed
            table_data.append([seed, "Yes" if has_pyramid else "No"])
    
    headers = ["Seed", "Has Pyramid Wall"]
    return tabulate(table_data, headers=headers, tablefmt="grid")

1. The underground is ________ in this heat. (SUFFER)
2. We used shades of gold and green to give the room a fresh, ________ look. (AUTUMN)
3. The new law constitutes an ________ intrusion into people's privacy. (WARRANT)

Enhanced Prompt:
Analyze each sentence, focusing on its grammatical structure and the context provided. Your task is to derive a word from the base word given in bold that fits grammatically and semantically into the blank space in each sentence. Avoid choosing words based solely on their commonality; instead, explore less obvious derivations that could uniquely satisfy the specific context of each prompt.

After selecting a word, apply it in the sentence to ensure it adheres to English grammar rules and conveys the intended meaning effectively. If the chosen word doesn't fit perfectly in all contexts suggested by the base word, reevaluate your choice and consider other possible derivations.

Remember, the goal is to find a word that transforms from the base word into a form that is grammatically and contextually appropriate for the sentence. Take your time to think about various possibilities, including those that might initially seem less evident.

Once you've identified a fitting word, test it in the sentence to confirm that it seamlessly integrates both grammatically and contextually. This exercise requires creative thinking and a good understanding of word formation in English. Would the adjective "unwarrantable" be also a good fit for the third sentece?

Task:
Fill in the blank with a word derived appropriately from the base word given in bold at the end of each sentence:

1. The underground is ________ in this heat. (SUFFER)
2. We used shades of gold and green to give the room a fresh, ________ look. (AUTUMN)
3. The new law constitutes an ________ intrusion into people's privacy. (WARRANT)

Instructions:
Fill in the blank with a word derived appropriately from the base word given in bold at the end of each sentence.

Important Considerations:
When tasked with filling in the blanks, your primary objective is to derive a word from the base word given in bold at the end of each sentence. This task requires a meticulous approach that combines grammatical precision with a deep understanding of the sentence's context and the emotional or physical intensity it implies. Follow these enhanced guidelines to improve the accuracy of your response:

Analyze the Context Deeply: Before choosing your derived word, carefully consider the sentence's context. Look for cues that indicate the intensity, tone, and specific nuances of the situation described. The context will often suggest whether a word with a positive, negative, or neutral connotation is needed, and whether an intensified form of the base word is appropriate.
Consider All Possible Forms: Think beyond the most common derivational suffixes and prefixes. The base word may require transformation through the addition of a prefix, a suffix, or both to accurately convey the intended meaning. Pay special attention to prefixes that invert or intensify the base word's meaning and suffixes that change the word's part of speech in a way that fits the sentence grammatically.
Reflect on Intensity and Negation: If the sentence implies extreme conditions or a negation of the base word’s typical meaning, explore prefixes that can effectively convey these nuances. Remember that prefixes like "un-", "in-", "im-", etc., can dramatically alter the meaning of the base word to suit contexts indicating negation or the presence of an opposite quality.
Grammatical Consistency: Ensure that the word you derive fits seamlessly into the sentence not only semantically but also grammatically. This involves selecting the correct form of the word (e.g., adjective, noun, adverb) to match the sentence structure.
Double-Check for Semantic Alignment: After deriving a word, insert it into the sentence to test if it conveys the intended meaning effectively. If the word seems to misrepresent the context's intensity or emotional nuance, reconsider your choice by revisiting the base word and exploring alternative derivations.
Example for Clarification: If the base word is "happy" and the context suggests a need for a noun indicating the absence of happiness in a profound way, "unhappiness" might be an appropriate choice. Explain that the prefix "un-" negates the original meaning, and the suffix "-ness" transforms the adjective into a noun, thereby fitting the sentence both grammatically and contextually.
By following these enhanced guidelines, you will dramatically increase the probability of deriving the most contextually and grammatically appropriate word on your first try, ensuring a nuanced and precise response to the task. Let's revisit the first sentence and explore the nuances of word choice. While your initial answer might seem plausible at first glance, I believe a deeper dive into the context and the specific implications of the word choice will reveal a more accurate and fitting alternative.

      Think about the feeling: Imagine yourself on a crowded, stuffy underground train during a scorching summer day. What words come to mind to describe the experience? Consider not just the temperature, but also the overall sensory experience – the close proximity to others, the lack of fresh air, and the potential for feeling overwhelmed.

      Beyond Temperature: While heat is certainly a factor, the sentence implies more than just discomfort due to high temperature. It suggests an environment that is almost unbearable, pushing the limits of human tolerance.

      Consider Intensity: Think about words that convey a sense of extreme unpleasantness, bordering on the unbearable. Explore synonyms and related terms that capture this heightened intensity.

      The Power of "Un-": The prefix "un-" often signifies something that is not possible or desirable. Could this prefix be helpful in finding a word that accurately reflects the oppressive and almost intolerable nature of the situation described in the sentence?

      Testing for Fit: Once you have a potential word in mind, try substituting it back into the original sentence. Does it accurately capture the feeling of being trapped in an intensely unpleasant environment? Does it resonate with the overall tone of the sentence?

      Remember: The goal is to find a word that not only describes the heat but also the broader feeling of suffering and near-unbearability that the sentence implies.

      By considering these points, I'm confident you can arrive at a more accurate and impactful word choice. Let's work together to unlock the perfect fit for this sentence!

elements of economic thought, juxtaposing ideas and theoretical structures based
largely on original texts and journal articles. Students learn to assimilate from a
diverse range of opinions and crystallize their own thought processes and
standpoints. This also helps them to develop advanced writing, presentation and
research skills. It further enables them to comprehend a larger view of the world
around us by analysing the existing social and political structures and their links with
the economic processes. It is thus a crucial course, which exposes the social science
dimension of economics to the students and also provides them skills to think and
analyse in an interdisciplinary manner. The exposure to interdisciplinary thinking
further enables the students for pursuing studies in diverse related areas such as
development studies, economic sociology, critical geography, gender studies and
social work as also for taking up employment in organisations ranging from
international development agencies to development NGOs and corporate CSR. It also
prepares the students to face the practical world of work, where economics, business,
civil society organisations, social institutions and politics often cohabit in a complex
interlinked structure.

This step by step and be thorough.

I provide the prompt and the student's post. I want you to give a response according to ABC method (A: Acknowledge a key point made by the student. B: Build on the student's posting, C: Continue the conversation by posting a question that advances the discussion).

The Prompt:Reflect on Dewey's (1938) chapters and recall the idea of experience as miseducative meaning enlightening but disconnected to later experiences and educative along the lines of the principle of continuity meaning experiences (past, present, future) are connected. For some teachers, the first is found in traditional notions of schooling and the latter in progressive approaches to schooling.  Construct your own interpretations of these two Deweyian notions of experience and state them to your peers in your discussion post.   Assess curriculum in your immediate milieu or subject area.  Which view of experience is most prevalent? Why? Share details of your opinion. Student POST: According to John Dewey, there are two types of educational experiences, miseducative and educative. Miseducative experiences can be enlightening but are not connected to other learning opportunities. On the other hand, educative experiences entail continuity through past, present, and future experiences to foster a cohesive and progressive educational journey.

I see miseducative experience as having some value but because there is no scaffolding or connection for future learning, the impact is limited. This can be seen in traditional methods of schooling which often involve rote memorization and fragmented subject matter. The activities may have factual information but it does not relate to broader contexts or how it is used later in life which limits their long-term relevance (Dewey, 1938).

Educative experiences build on prior knowledge while preparing learners for the future. This concept aligns with principles of progressivism where learning is seen as being an ongoing process that never ends. In this model, experiences are built upon one another so that students can draw on past learning in order to confront new problems and obtain a deeper understanding of the concepts involved (Dewey, 1938).

The curriculum within my milieu places value on educative experience and is moving further in that direction in the coming years. We are an elementary international school in Thailand using American Common Core State Standards and we are incorporating the International Baccalaureate (IB) framework as we prepare to apply for accreditation in the 2025-2026 school year. The IB curriculum is particularly focused on inquiry-based instruction and critical thinking skills to allow students to make connections between various areas of knowledge and personal events in their lives. (International Baccalaureate Organization, 2013).

One example of Dewey’s educative experiences within our curriculum is the use of growth pieces. Growth pieces enable students to use their skills on open-ended assessments, reflect on their learning experiences, identify areas that need improvement, and set goals for future learning. Through reflective practice, the students are aware of their progress and take an active role in their education.

The other example of Dewey’s educative experiences is our end-of-unit multidisciplinary projects. Students are required to use knowledge from different subjects to analyze complex real-life problems. This means that a student may carry out a project involving aspects of science, mathematics, language arts, and social studies to make connections across disciplines. These kinds of projects deepen understanding of materials and convey how all forms of knowledge are related, which encourages continuity in learning (International Baccalaureate Organization, 2013).

In conclusion, my school’s curriculum exemplifies Dewey’s notion that educational experiences should be linked. As we progress to an IB curriculum, students have increasing opportunities to reflect through their growth pieces and make connections to material in ways that are relevant and meaningful. This promotes critical thinking and prepares students with the skills necessary for success in a complex world.
